pipeline_overview.description: At Novo Nordisk, our R&D pipeline reflects our long-standing commitment to driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic conditions. Our scientists are currently working on novel and innovative treatments to address the unmet needs of people living with diabetes, obesity, cardiovascular disease, rare blood and endocrine disorders, and other serious chronic diseases.

phase_1.name: Pumpsulin
phase_1.description: A novel insulin analogue ideal for use in a closed loop pump device as delivery.

phase_1.name: Glucose sensitive insulin
phase_1.description: A glucose-sensitive insulin analogue intended for once-daily treatment.

phase_1.name: DNA immunotherapy
phase_1.description: A novel plasmid encoding pre- and pro-insulin intended for preservation of beta cell function.

phase_1.name: Amylin 355
phase_1.description: A once-weekly subcutaneous amylin analogue for the treatment of obesity

phase_1.name: Oral Amycretin
phase_1.description: A long-acting co-agonist of GLP-1 and amylin intended for once daily oral treatment

phase_1.name: Subcutaneous Amycretin
phase_1.description: A long-acting co-agonist of GLP-1 and amylin intended for once weekly subcutaneous injection

phase_1.name: INV-347
phase_1.description: Next generation oral small molecule CB1 receptor blocker

phase_1.name: UBT251 (GGG tri-agonist)
phase_1.indication: Obesity, type 2 diabetes and other diseases
phase_1.description: A triple agonist of the receptors for GLP-1, GIP, and glucagon

phase_1.name: Amylin 1213
phase_1.description: A once-weekly subcutaneous amylin analogue for the treatment of obesity

phase_1.name: Tri-agonist
phase_1.description: A once-weekly subcutaneous tri-agonist for the treatment of obesity

phase_1.name: Anti ANGPTL3
phase_1.description: A monoclonal antibody in development for cardiovascular disease

phase_1.name: CNP
phase_1.description: A C-type natriuretic peptide (CNP) analogue in development for heart failure

phase_1.name: NLRP3 inhibitor
phase_1.description: An oral treatment in a broad range of liver, kidney and cardiometabolic diseases

phase_1.name: Cell Therapy in heart failure
phase_1.description: A cell therapy using purified cardiomyocytes derived from induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSC)

phase_1.name: MARC1
phase_1.description: An siRNA targeting MARC1 for subcutaneous treatment

phase_1.name: LXRα
phase_1.description: An siRNA targeting LXRα for subcutaneous treatment

phase_1.name: Cell therapy in Parkinson's disease
phase_1.description: A cell therapy using stem cell-derived nerve cells

phase_1.name: Inno8
phase_1.description: An oral, once-daily antibody fragment for the treatment of haemophilia

phase_1.name: TMPRSS6
phase_1.description: An RNAi in development for the rare blood disease Hereditary Haemochromatosis

phase_2.name: Subcutaneous Amycretin
phase_2.description: A long-acting co-agonist of GLP-1 and amylin intended for once weekly subcutaneous injection

phase_2.name: Monlunabant in DKD
phase_2.description: An oral small molecule CB1 receptor blocker

phase_2.name: Once weekly GLP-1/GIP
phase_2.description: A once weekly subcutaneous dual GLP-1/GIP receptor agonist

phase_2.name: Oral Amycretin
phase_2.description: A long-acting co-agonist of GLP-1 and amylin intended for once daily oral treatment

phase_2.name: FUSE
phase_2.description: A collaboration with GE Healthcare, using ultrasound for once-monthly treatment

phase_2.name: FUSE
phase_2.description: A collaboration with GE Healthcare, using ultrasound for once-monthly treatment

phase_2.name: Once weekly GLP-1/GIP
phase_2.description: A once weekly subcutaneous dual GLP-1/GIP receptor agonist

phase_2.name: Monlunabant
phase_2.description: An oral small molecule CB1 receptor blocker

phase_2.name: CDR132L
phase_2.indication: Heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF)
phase_2.description: An antisense oligonucleotide (ASO) targeting the microRNA molecule miR-132

phase_2.name: NDec
phase_2.description: An oral combination of decitabine and tetrahydrouridine

phase_2.name: Coramitug
phase_2.description: An anti-amyloid immunotherapy treatment for ATTR

phase_2.name: Zalfermin
phase_2.description: A long-acting FGF21 analogue for once-weekly treatment

phase_2.name: Etavopivat
phase_2.description: A selective pyruvate kinase-R (PKR) activator intended for once daily oral treatment

phase_3.name: Oral Semaglutide 25 mg and 50 mg
phase_3.description: Oral GLP-1 25 and 50 mg, intended for once-daily treatment

phase_3.name: CagriSema in T2D
phase_3.description: A combination of amylin analogue and GLP-1 analogue semaglutide intended for once-weekly treatment

phase_3.name: CagriSema
phase_3.description: A combination of amylin analogue cagrilintide and GLP-1 analogue semaglutide intended for once-weekly subcutaneous treatment

phase_3.name: Semaglutide 7.2 mg
phase_3.description: A long-acting GLP-1 analogue intended as a once-weekly treatment for obesity

phase_3.name: Ziltivekimab ASCVD
phase_3.indication: Atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) with chronic kidney disease (CKD) and inflammation
phase_3.description: A novel once-monthly monoclonal antibody intended for inhibition of IL-6 activity

phase_3.name: Ziltivekimabin HFpEF
phase_3.indication: Heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF)
phase_3.description: A novel once-monthly monoclonal antibody intended for inhibition of IL-6 activity

phase_3.name: Ziltivekimab AMI
phase_3.description: A novel once-monthly monoclonal antibody intended for inhibition of IL-6 activity

phase_3.name: Oral Semaglutide Alzheimer's
phase_3.description: Oral semaglutide 14 mg once-daily for the treatment of early Alzheimer's disease

phase_3.name: Mim8
phase_3.indication: Haemophilia A with or without inhibitors
phase_3.description: A next generation FVIII mimetic bispecific antibody for subcutaneous prophylaxis

phase_3.name: Etavopivat (Sickle Cell Disease)
phase_3.description: Oral, small molecule activator of erythrocyte pyruvate kinase (PKR)

filed.name: Icosema
filed.description: A combination of GLP-1 analogue semaglutide and insulin icodec intended for once-weekly treatment

filed.name: Insulin icodec
filed.description: A long-acting basal insulin analogue intended for once weekly dosing

filed.name: Oral Sema Obesity
filed.description: A long acting GLP-1 analogue intended for once-daily treatment

filed.name: Semaglutide MASH
filed.description: A long-acting GLP-1 analogue for once-weekly treatment of MASH

filed.name: Concizumab
filed.indication: Haemophilia A and B with inhibitors
filed.description: Treatment for haemophilia A and B with inhibitors
